source.0ce81921:
# importing important libraries
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.663e5911:
original_data = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/pakistanintellectualcapitalcs/Pakistan Intellectual Capital - Computer Science - Ver 1.csv', encoding="latin1")
data_copy_1 = original_data.copy()  # making copy of data
data_copy_1.head()  # diplaying initial 5 rows
source.8023e724:
# Renaming columns names for convinience
data_copy_1 = data_copy_1.rename(columns={
    "Teacher Name": "teacher_name",
    "University Currently Teaching": "current_university",
    "Department": "department",
    "Province University Located": "province",
    "Designation": "designation",
    "Terminal Degree": "degree",
    "Graduated from": "graduated_from",
    "Country": "country",
    "Year": "year",
    "Area of Specialization/Research Interests": "specialization",
    "Other Information": "other_information"
})
data_copy_1.head()  # Displaying initial five rows
source.13f6e65f:
# Droping "S#" column becauuse it is of no use as we have index
# Also dropping "other_information" column as it has almost all the null values
data_copy_1.drop(["S#", "other_information"], axis=1, inplace=True)
# Checking null values
data_copy_1.isnull().sum()
source.327058c7:
specializations = pd.DataFrame(data_copy_1['specialization'])
specializations['specialization'].isnull().sum()  # Number of null values in 'specialization' column
source.916c8824: specializations.dropna(inplace=True) # Dropping the rows with null values
source.30cb6b20:
specializations['specialization'] = specializations.specialization.str.lower()  # converting into lower case
specializations['specialization'] = specializations.specialization.str.replace('.', '') # removing all periods '.'
specializations['specialization'] = specializations.specialization.str.replace('and ', '') # removing all the 'and '
# As majority of the records in this cloumn have multiple areas of interets separated by commas ',' so splitting the records on the basis of commas ','
specializations['specialization'] = specializations.specialization.str.split(',')
source.46473db8:
# making a list which contains areas of interests individually
lst = []
for i in specializations['specialization']:
    for j in i:
        lst.append(j.strip())

# making a dataframe which contains the areas of interests individually in rows
df = pd.DataFrame(lst)
source.46573662:
# reseting tthe index
task1_frame = task1_frame.reset_index()
# changing columns names
task1_frame = task1_frame.rename(columns={
    'index': 'area_of_interest',
    'area_of_interest': 'count'
})
source.43267ba7:
# plotting top 15 areas of interests
plt.figure(figsize=(15, 8))
sns.barplot(x=task1_frame.loc[0:14, 'area_of_interest'], y=task1_frame.loc[0:14, 'count'])
plt.xticks(rotation=90, fontsize=15)
plt.yticks(fontsize=15)
plt.xlabel("Areas of Interest", fontsize=15)
plt.ylabel("Count", fontsize=15)
plt.title("Top Areas of Interests", fontsize=20)
plt.show()
source.3c0939a2:
# Replacing "Macau" with "China" and "Urbana" with "USA"
countries['country'] = countries['country'].str.strip()
countries.loc[countries['country'] == "Urbana", "country"] = "USA"
countries.loc[countries['country'] == "Macau", "country"] = "China"
source.cdd08475:

sns.barplot(x=task_3a.loc[0:15, 'country'], y=task_3a.loc[0:15, 'count'])
plt.xticks(rotation=90, fontsize=15)
plt.yticks(fontsize=15)
plt.xlabel("Country", fontsize=15)
plt.ylabel("Count", fontsize=15)
plt.title("Which country hosted most Pakitani Phd holders", fontsize=20)
plt.show()

# restting index

source.1d85a656:
# Plotting the bar plot showing top 15 universities which hosted Pakistani professors
plt.figure(figsize=(15, 8))
sns.barplot(x=task_3b.loc[0:15, 'graduated_from'], y=task_3b.loc[0:15, 'count'])
plt.xticks(rotation=90, fontsize=15)
plt.yticks(fontsize=15)
plt.xlabel("Univerity", fontsize=15)
plt.ylabel("Number of Professors", fontsize=15)
plt.title("Top 15 universities which hosted most of the Pakistani professors", fontsize=20)
plt.show()

source.5d9295c0:
# Converting all the "phd" written in different formats in "Phd" format
phds.loc[phds['degree']=='PhD',           'degree'] = 'Phd'
phds.loc[phds['degree']=='Ph.D(Scholar)', 'degree'] = 'Phd'
phds.loc[phds['degree']=='Ph.D (Scholar)','degree'] = 'Phd'
phds.loc[phds['degree']=='Ph.D',          'degree'] = 'Phd'

source.4fb40a7c: According ti this [HEC data](http://hec.gov.pk/english/universities/Pages/AJK/University-wise-Full-time-faculty.aspx) there are about 10,133 full PhD faculty members in Pakistan in all Pakistani universities.
source.befab3e8: This graph is showing the most common areas of researchs in Pakistan.
source.b71ec81f: **By analzing the data we get to see that there are many important fields in which we have very less number of professors such as "data science" which is mentioned by only 4 professors as thier area of interest and "cyber security" which is mentioned by only 1 professors as thier area of interest**
source.b94ec081:
The number of persons in whose area of interest comes the words data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence are as follows:
* Data Science: 4
* Machine Learning: 91
* Artificial Intelligence: 77
source.4b44bcea:
According to this dataset there are 485 Pd.D. degree holder professors in Pakistan.
According to [HEC data](http://hec.gov.pk/english/universities/Pages/AJK/University-wise-enrollment-of-yearwise.aspx) there are around 1.2 million students who got enrolled in universities all around Pakistan in different degrees in 2014-2015. This [HEC data](http://hec.gov.pk/english/universities/Pages/AJK/PhD-Produced-by-Pakistani-Universities.aspx) shows that there are total 10,691 PhD degree awarded by both public and private sector universities from 2010 to 2014.
source.8e520e5e: **From this plot we can see "software engineering" and "machine learning" are the top areas of interest which are specifically mentioned**
